l%cqhf2x}VB@psAr7M%r.text: 箭頭指的方向就是太空人的前方

WORDS: Please lead me to safe area.
The green area is safe zone.
Please use the arrow keys to take me to a safe  zone
Assist your team crew to the safe area
In deep space astronauts also lose the shielding  provided by the Earth’s strong magnetic field.
So, to keep your crew healthy,  it is necessary to monitor the radiation  environment inside and outside  a manned spacecraft.
Active monitoring of space radiation levels within  the Space Station is achieved with dosimeters  .
both to identify the best-shielded locations  within the Space Station and to give early  warning should radiation levels increase during a mission due to solar storms.
Compares and contrasts various missions and their durations with the observed radiation dose.
For a six-month journey to Mars an astronaut would be exposed to roughly 300 mSv, or a total of 600 mSv for the round-trip.
If we assume that the crew would spend 18 months on the surface while they wait for the planets to realign to make the journey back to Earth possible,
they will be exposed to an additional 400 mSv, for a grand total exposure of about 1,200 mSv.
Here is Examples of Health Effects from acute radiation exposure
The acute effects in this table are cumulative.
For example, a dose that causes damage to bone marrow will produce changes in blood chemistry and be accompanied by nausea.
When excessive solar radiation is detected, Your team member is uncomfortable
you must guide your crew to hide in a safe area as soon as possible to avoid excessive radiation exposure
When we guide the team members, we must use the direction of the team members as the benchmark, not our direction.
So, First point, The direction indicated by the arrow is the direction the astronaut is facing
2nd, Keyboard arrow keys represent four directions
Up arrow is to go back
Left key is to turn right
Right arrow is to turn left
This is the map in the capsule  The green area is a safe area to avoid space radiation
Due to the influence of space radiation, the map showing the location of the team members will be intermittent, and the direction will not be fixed.
As just explained, you must guide the group member to evacuate as soon as possible based on the face of the group member.
Remind again, The map direction will rotate randomly due to the influence of solar radiation.
But the movement direction of the keyboard guide your crew is fixed
Assist your team crew to the safe area
radiation levels increase during a mission due to solar storms
